meanings.definition: To lie or sit with arms and legs spread out awkwardly.
meanings.sent1: The tired dog sprawled on the floor after a long walk.
meanings.sent2: She sprawled on the couch, exhausted from the day's activities.
meanings.sent3: The cat sprawled out on the table, claiming it as her own.
meanings.sent4: The vines sprawled across the garden, creating a beautiful natural carpet.
meanings.sent5: The children sprawled on the grass, enjoying the warm sun on their faces.

meanings.definition: To spread out over a large area in an untidy or irregular way.
meanings.sent1: The papers sprawled across the desk, waiting to be organized.
meanings.sent2: The city sprawled along the coastline, with buildings reaching towards the sky.
meanings.sent3: The toys sprawled all over the living room, evidence of a playful afternoon.
meanings.sent4: The ivy sprawled up the old brick wall, adding a touch of green to the urban landscape.
meanings.sent5: The crowd sprawled out in the park, enjoying a picnic under the shade of the trees.
